p:
On 4 February 2020, an editorial in Springer Nature® conducted by Wang et al. was one of the first to describe the effects of CQ in conjunction with other five antiviral drugs in Vero E6 cells infected with nCoV2019BetaCoV.
35 They performed a standard in vitro assay in 2019-nCoV clinical specimens to elucidate the antiviral activity in terms of cytotoxicity, virus yield, and infection rate. Notably, their time-of-addition assay showed that CQ blocked the virus at low concentrations during both entry and post-entry phases of cellular infection. They concluded that CQ has a high prospect in 2019-nCoV as it is a standard drug with known safety profile, is relatively cheap, achieves a wide volume of distribution after oral intake, and can easily attain the EC90 seen in Vero E6 (6.90 μM) with standard 500 mg dose.
